definition: to speak/to talk/to converse/to chat/to discuss

sentences.english: Jim and I have just had a long talk.
sentences.chinese: 我和吉姆剛進行過一次長談。

sentences.english: A long conversation with a friend.
sentences.chinese: 和好友的一次促膝長談。

sentences.english: I spent 4 hours chatting with my grandmother in-law last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚，我和丈夫的祖母促膝長談了4個小時。

sentences.english: I have long talked with him on the subject.
sentences.chinese: 關於這個問題我已經和他作過一次長談。

sentences.english: I've really enjoyed our long talks together at lunch.
sentences.chinese: 我十分喜愛我們在午飯後的長談。

sentences.english: Whenthe employee leaves your office after a long talk stand up to say good- bye.
sentences.chinese: 當僱員和你長談之後要離開你辦公室時，起身道別。

sentences.english: Time alone with a good book.
sentences.chinese: 和好友的一次促膝長談。

sentences.english: Call a friend you haven't spoken to recently and have a good long chat.
sentences.chinese: 給一個近來沒聯繫過的朋友打電話，美美的長談一番。

sentences.english: But it’s OK to have long talks with your children.
sentences.chinese: 但是和孩子進行一次長談是可以的。

sentences.english: I had a long talk with her that night.
sentences.chinese: 那天晚上，我和她秉燭長談。

sentences.english: I went down to meet him at the end of last season and had a long chat with him.
sentences.chinese: 上賽季末我去探望過他，並跟他促膝長談過。

sentences.english: Just want to pull a long process bite gold, but female manager came after.
sentences.chinese: 正想拉住程咬金長談一番，不料女掌櫃追了過來。

sentences.english: When the employee leaves your office after a long talk, stand up to say good- bye.
sentences.chinese: 當僱員和你長談之後要離開你辦公室時，起身道別。

sentences.english: We used to have long phone talks about our babies to share some fun and loss.
sentences.chinese: 我們過去常常在電話里長談我們的寶寶，分享樂與失。

sentences.english: As a good long talk with a few old friends.
sentences.chinese: 比和幾個老朋友促膝長談更加有效。

sentences.english: On New Year's Eve, my father and my uncle talked about their work together.
sentences.chinese: 除夕那天，我的爸爸和叔叔促膝長談他們的工作。
